definition: In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]
to capture
happening/instance/reason/cause/intentional/former/old/friend/therefore/hence/(of people) to die, dead
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if

sentences.english: He nudged her gently. She nuzzled him back.
sentences.chinese: 他向她溫柔地推了推，她用鼻子愛撫他，欲擒故縱。

sentences.english: I'd like to make a meeting with Mr.
sentences.chinese: 你看欲擒故縱我想約見史密斯師長。

sentences.english: I am not playing hard to get.
sentences.chinese: 我不想玩欲擒故縱的遊戲。

sentences.english: Releasing in order to catch is one of the general methods in view point of philosophy of environmental technology.
sentences.chinese: 欲擒故縱法是環境工藝哲學意義上的一般方法。

sentences.english: An aloof attitude will do the trick.
sentences.chinese: 玩一把欲擒故縱的把戲吧。

sentences.english: I guess she's trying to play hard-to-get.
sentences.chinese: 我想，她大概想跟我玩“欲擒故縱”的遊戲吧。

sentences.english: Some girls like to play hard to get .
sentences.chinese: 有些女孩子喜歡玩欲擒故縱的把戲。

sentences.english: I guess you're trying to play hard-to-get.
sentences.chinese: 大概你想跟我玩“欲擒故縱”的遊戲吧。

sentences.english: Do boys like girls who enjoy playing hard-to-get?
sentences.chinese: 男生會喜歡愛玩欲擒故縱遊戲的女生嗎？

definition: lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush

(coll.) to pester/to harass
lit. eats soft food, but refuses hard food (idiom)/amenable to coaxing but not coercion
brief period of enthusiasm/flash in the pan
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to use force
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
fickle in love/sentimentality
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
to look cold and indifferent/standoffish
brazen
